Class of 1982 Sequentiary

Link
libraries.mit.edu
Status
active
How they describe themselves
digitization
Blurb
The Class of 1982 Sequentiary is a book — donated to the MIT Lewis Music Library by the MIT Class of 1982 — from the 15th or early 16th century that contains text and music of a genre of chants called “sequences.” The singing of sequences was largely removed from the Catholic Mass during the reforms of the Counter-Reformation, and thus intact sequentiaries are quite rare. This project was an experiment created to support the Medieval and Renaissance Music (21M.220) class taught by Professor Michael Cuthbert for Spring 2017.
Creator(s)
Michael Scott Cuthbert
Steward(s)
MIT Libraries
Tools used
Mirador, IIIF
